entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/2. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F21: TÁRKI Omnibus 2002/2. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19

entry.dcterms:description: 1) popularity of politicians, party preferences, voting behavior, popularity of Prime Minister candidates, satisfaction with democracy, satisfaction with the work of the government and opposition, political self-categorization, subjective financial situation, economic expectations 2) admitting refugees, special treatment of Hungarians abroad, reception of the status law by the popularion in Hungary, knowledge about the status law, evaluation of foreigners taking jobs in Hungary 3) book reading habits, using the library, number of books at home, habits of buying books, preference for genres and publishing houses 4) conflicts in the family, violence in the family, women battering 5) preference for car brands 6) habits of taking a holiday
entry.dcterms:subject: mass political behavior, attitudes
political ideology
income, property and savings
migration
cultural activities and participation
mass media
leisure, tourism and sport
family life, marriage, relationship
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: A, block 5: D, block 6: A
